intro: Tibouchina bourgaeana, commonly known as the pink hibiscus or pink tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tibouchina bourgaeana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and long-lasting floral display.
